title: SHO energy - block velocity at half the amplitude

content.question: A block on a horizontal surface is attached to one end of a spring, and the other end of the spring is attached to a fixed wall, as shown in the figure. The block is released from rest at a distance <math alttext="d sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> to the right of its equilibrium position and oscillates with negligible friction along the horizontal surface. The block has a speed <math alttext="v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math> when it passes through the equilibrium position. What is the instantaneous speed of the block when it is at a distance <math alttext="the fraction d sub 0, end sub, over 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> from equilibrium?

choices.label: <math alttext="one fourth, v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>
<math alttext="one half, v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the square root of 2, end fraction, v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator the square root of 3, end root, and denominator 2, end fraction, v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator the square root of 3, end root, and denominator 2, end fraction, v sub max" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>max</mi></msub></math>
